group.name: Particles
group.string: Create a spray of particles. Useful for visual effects.

group.name: properties
group.string: Number of particles to create per second, or total for one-shot.
Number of degrees through which particles are created.
Either a spray or a one-shot blast of particles.
Click to edit the particle image.
Choose an effect for this object. (This does not preview in the layout, only when you run.)
(none)|Additive|XOR|Copy|Destination over|Source in|Destination in|Source out|Destination out|Source atop|Destination atop
Properties affecting the creation of each particle.
Initial particle speed, in pixels per second.
Initial size of each particle, in pixels.
Initial opacity of each particle, from 0 (transparent) to 100 (opaque).
Rate the size changes over time, in pixels per second.
Random X co-ordinate offset on creation.
Random Y co-ordinate offset on creation.
Random addition to particle speed on creation.
Random addition to particle size on creation.
Random addition to particle grow rate on creation.
Properties affecting the behavior of each particle.
Acceleration of each particle, in pixels per second per second.
Force of gravity, in pixels per second per second.
Maximum random angle deflection in degrees per second.
Maximum random speed adjustment per second, in pixels per second per second.
Maximum random opacity adjustment per second.
Choose when each individual particle is destroyed.
Time in seconds for timeout or fade to invisible (depending on destroy mode).

group.name: cnds
group.string: True if the continuous spray is currently enabled.

group.name: acts
group.string: Enable or disable the continuous spray.
Whether or not the spray is currently enabled.
Set the number of particles created per second.
Number of particles to create per second.
Set the number of degrees through which particles are created.
Number of degrees through which particles are created.
Set the rendering effect of this object.
Choose the new effect for this object.
Initial particle speed, in pixels per second.
Set the initial size of each particle.
Initial size of each particle, in pixels.
Initial opacity of each particle, from 0 (transparent) to 100 (opaque).
Set the initial particle grow rate.
Rate the size changes over time, in pixels per second.
Set initial particle X randomiser to {0}
Set the initial particle X randomiser.
Random X co-ordinate offset on creation.
Set initial particle Y randomiser to {0}
Set the initial particle Y randomiser.
Random Y co-ordinate offset on creation.
Set initial particle speed randomiser to {0}
Set the random addition to particle speed on creation.
Random addition to particle speed on creation.
Set initial particle size randomiser to {0}
Set the random addition to particle size on creation.
Random addition to particle size on creation.
Set initial particle grow rate randomiser to {0}
Set the random addition to particle grow rate on creation.
Random addition to particle grow rate on creation.
Particle acceleration, in pixels per second per second.
Force of gravity, in pixels per second per second.
Set the maximum random angle deflection per second.
Maximum random angle deflection in degrees per second.
Set the maximum random speed adjustment per second.
Maximum random speed adjustment per second, in pixels per second per second.
Set the maximum random opacity adjustment per second.
Maximum random opacity adjustment per second.
Set the destroy timeout or fade to invisible time.
Time in seconds for timeout or fade to invisible (depending on destroy mode).

group.name: exps
group.string: The number of particles created per second.
The number of degrees through which particles are created.
The initial particle speed, in pixels per second.
The initial particle size, in pixels.
The initial particle opacity, from 0 (transparent) to 100 (opaque).
The initial particle grow rate, in pixels per second.
The random X offset on creation.
The random Y offset on creation.
The random addition to particle speed on creation.
The random addition to particle size on creation.
The random addition to particle grow rate on creation.
The particle acceleration in pixels per second per second.
The force of gravity in pixels per second per second.
The maximum random angle deflection in degrees per second.
The maximum random change in speed in pixels per second per second.
The maximum change in opacity per second.
The destroy or fade to invisible timeout.
